# go vet should set the GoVersion to go.mod's go version.
# The package and the file should return the same version.
go vet -x -json example.com/m
stderr '"GoVersion": "go1.22.0"'
go vet -x -json main.go
stderr '"GoVersion": "go1.22.0"'

go mod edit -go 1.21.1
! go vet -x -json example.com/m
stderr 'requires go1.22'
! go vet -x -json main.go
stderr 'requires go1.22'

# In workspace mode, the GoVersion should be the go.work's go version.
go mod edit -go 1.22.0
cp go.work.orig go.work
go vet -x -json main.go
stderr '"GoVersion": "go1.22.2"'

go work edit -go 1.21.1
! go vet -x -json main.go

-- go.mod --
module example.com/m

go 1.22.0

-- go.work.orig --
go 1.22.2

-- main.go --
package main

func main() {
        for i := range 10 {
                go func() { println(i) }()
        }
}
